00002 #define _STREAMIO_H
00003 
00004 /*
00005  * Generic Stream I/O that uses a simple object with vectored functions.
00006  *
00007  * Author: Phil Burk
00008  * Copyright 1999 Phil Burk
00009  */
00010 #ifndef NULL
00011 #define NULL   ((void *) 0)
00012 #endif
00013 
00014 #ifdef __cplusplus
00015 extern "C"
00016 {
00017 #endif
00018 
00019 typedef struct StreamIO
00020 {
00021         /* Read data from stream at current position. Return number of bytes read. */
00022         int (*read)( struct StreamIO *stream, char *buf, int numBytes );
00023         /* Write data to stream at current position. Return number of bytes read. */
00024         int (*write)( struct StreamIO *stream, char *buf, int numBytes );
00025         /* Seek to a certain position in the stream. */
00026         int (*setPosition)( struct StreamIO *stream,  int offset );
00027         /* Tell current position in stream. */
00028         int (*getPosition)( struct StreamIO *stream );
00029         /* Close stream. */
00030         void (*close)( struct StreamIO *stream );
00031         /* Get address if an in-memory stream, or return NULL. */
00032         char *(*getAddress)( struct StreamIO *stream );
00033 }
00034 StreamIO;
00035 
00036 StreamIO *Stream_OpenImage( char *dataPtr, int numBytes );
00037 StreamIO *Stream_OpenFile( char *fileName, char *mode );
00038 
00039 int Stream_Read( StreamIO *sio, char *buffer, int numBytes );
00040 int Stream_Write( StreamIO *sio, char *buffer, int numBytes );
00041 int Stream_SetPosition( StreamIO *sio, int offset );
00042 int Stream_GetPosition( StreamIO *sio );
00043 void Stream_Close( StreamIO *sio );
00044 
00045 #define Stream_GetAddress(sio)  ((sio)->getAddress(sio))
